alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 12:35PM MST until September 21 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MST/445 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Navajo and east central Coconino counties. * WHEN...Until 345 PM MST /445 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1232 PM MST /132 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Keams Canyon Wash, Polacca Wash, Coyote Wash, Jeddito Wash, Bluebird Canyon Wash, Little Colorado River, Moenkopi Wash, Oraibi Wash, Wepo Wash, Saltwater Wash, Dinnebito Wash, Burnt Corn Wash and Tees Toh Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... First Mesa, Hard Rock, Tolani Lake, Shongopovi, Second Mesa, Kykotsmovi Village, Hotevilla, Polacca, and Pinon. - This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 358 and 400. State Route 99 near mile marker 62. State Route 87 between mile markers 387 and 406. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
